102400.name: Bookhounds of London Limited Edition Package
rpghonor: 2012 Golden Geek Best RPG Supplement Nominee
102400.description:
From the Pelgrane website:

The limited edition will include:

A limited edition faux leather bound, gold-embossed copy of Bookhounds of London, signed by Kenneth Hite with a Lovecraftian word added in his fair hand. The full list of 110 words will be published after the books are released.
A limited edition of Augustus Darcy’s Occult Guide (Liber Fumo de Frater Viglio) presented as an in world-artifact, hardbound, cloth covered, numbered, gold embossed with an exclusive dust cover. To the extent we can, we have left no trace of its modern origins. You get the PDF of the Occult Guide now with your order.
Genuine 1930s ephemera selected from by Steve and Paula Dempsey (contributor and Occult Guide writer respectively), divided as evenly as possible between each limited edition. While some people will do better than others we think no one will be disappointed.
A unique clue to the death of Augustus Darcy.




All this presented in Augustus Darcy’s olive green haversack, protected by a mystic sigil.

102401.name: MotorStorm: Arctic Edge
videogamefranchise: Platinum Range (Best Selling PlayStation Games, PAL)
videogamehonor: 2009 Gamescom Best Mobile/Handheld Game of the Year Nominee
102401.description:
MotorStorm: Arctic Edge is the third entry in the MotorStorm series of video games, developed by Bigbig Studios and published by Sony Computer Entertainment for the PlayStation 2 and PlayStation Portable. It was released on the PlayStation Portable on 18 September 2009 in Europe, 29 September 2009 in North America, on the PlayStation 2 in October 2009 and on 1 November 2009 in Japan. Unlike previous games in the series, the game was developed by Bigbig Studios and it's the first game in the series not to be released on the PlayStation 3.

Source: Wikipedia, "MotorStorm: Arctic Edge", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

102403.name: MotorStorm: Pacific Rift
videogamefranchise: Platinum Range (Best Selling PlayStation Games, PAL)
videogamehonor: 2008 Game Critics Best Racing Game of the Year Nominee
2009 British Academy Game Awards Best Sports Game of the Year Nominee
2009 D.I.C.E. Racing Game of the Year Nominee
102403.description:
MotorStorm: Pacific Rift is a racing video game by Evolution Studios and published by Sony Computer Entertainment for the PlayStation 3. It is the sequel to MotorStorm and is followed by MotorStorm: Arctic Edge for the PS2/PSP, and will be followed by MotorStorm: Apocalypse. It was announced by Sony after their acquisition of Evolution Studios and it was released on 28 October 2008 in North America. The game has sold over one million copies as of 9 December 2008.

Source: Wikipedia, "MotorStorm: Pacific Rift", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

102404.name: Gypsy
102404.description:
Back of the Box

Gypsy - Be prepared to face the test of survival!

Here you are, a happy-go-lucky gypsy moth in the garden of your dreams. You have just discovered your favorite bill of fair - an exotic Oak tree - in some unsuspecting human's back yard. Now is the time, you decide, to fill your parched belly on this gourmet meal, leaf by luscious leaf.

But beware! You are not alone in this would-be moth paradise. Before you masticate upon the juicy foliage you must be prepared to face enemies on all quarters. The dangers include;
- The deadly Flying Ant of Tasmania
- The notorious Fandango Bee
- The dreaded Locknest Spider

In Gyspy, you must not only avoid the bites and stings of these nasties, you must also nourish your frail bug body or you will soon be belly-up, so to speak.

102405.name: Rent-A-Hero
102405.description:
Rent-A-Hero is a top-down role-playing video game series released by Sega for the Mega Drive console in 1991 with a large emphasis on humor. The game features the same graphic engine previously used in the development of Phantasy Star III. However, Rent-A-Hero has an unusual innovation for the genre. Instead of using standard turn-based battles, fights are in a similar format to 2D fighting games.

Taro Yamada, or Rent-A-Hero (レンタヒーロー, Renta Hīrō?) lives in the town of Corja in Japan with his mother, eccentric father and younger sister Alyssa; the family moved there after his father changed jobs. He received his Combat Armor by accident during their house-warming party, when he ordered pizza from 'Sensational Cafeteria' or SECA and instead received the suit. After realizing the suit gave him incredible strength and that he is required to pay for the armor, Taro decides to become a hero for hire, performing various heroic tasks and odd-jobs for the townspeople of Corja.

Source: Wikipedia, "Rent-A-Hero", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

102406.name: Bahamut Senki
102406.description:
Bahamut Senki​ (バハムート戦記,? lit. "War Chronicles of Bahamut") is a tactical role-playing game developed by Sega for the Sega Mega Drive in 1991. It was only released in Japan.

The game offers a unique soundtrack for each of the many playable "races" in the game, and has various levels of gameplay that ranged from arcade Archon-style creature-on-creature combat to strategy similar to Koei's strategy games like Gemfire and Nobunaga's Ambition. Two-player games are also an option, given the variety that the game offered with the occasional arcade action battle to break up the quiet strategy and planning.

Source: Wikipedia, "Bahamut Senki", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

102408.name: Clear for Action
102408.description:
Back of the box

Clear for Action recreates ship-to-ship combat in the age of fighting sail in such staggering detail that only a computer can handle it! Select from a library of over 50 ships from the countries of England, Spain, France, the Netherlands, Denmark... and a small struggling nation known as the United States. Relive many of the significant naval actions of this historic period with the eleven scenarios provided, or 'build' your own ships and fight it out with up to seven other friends or against the computer.

102409.name: The Hybrid Front
102409.description:
The Hybrid Front is a Sega Mega Drive war-based video game, released in Japan on July 22, 1994. It was re-released on May 29, 2007 for the Virtual Console. The introduction begins with someone logging into a computer. Then, it shows a revolution that occurred sometime in the 2080s leading into wars and conflicts that are further into the future.

However, the actual game takes place in the 26th century. A hostile group of corporate war hawks called CoCoON (Cocoon: the National Coalition on Track Companies) have revolted against the peaceful coalition of the PETO (Pan-Global Coalition). In response, the player must fight a futuristic war using infantry, aircraft, tanks, and other surprises. Friendly units are given the blue color, allied units are orange, while enemy units are in red. Units can be placed either manually or automatically by pressing the Start button on the Sega Mega Drive. Mild violence is present in the game, although blood is absent.

Source: Wikipedia, "The Hybrid Front", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

102410.description:

102411.name: Dawn of Defiance Gamemaster Primer
102411.description:
From Introduction:

The Dawn of Defiance campaign is more than just a string of adventures. It is a complete story arc that takes in the saga, depth, and emotion of the Star Wars films and translates their core concepts into a unique roleplaying game campaign. Over the course of the campaign, the heroes will liberate worlds from the grip of the Empire, delve into the ancient secrets of the now-extinct Jedi, and feel the bitter taste of betrayal at the hands of a trusted ally.

This document presents an overview of each adventure and, by extension, the campaign as a whole. The descriptions provide Gamemasters with the basics of all 10 downloadable adventures.

Of course, each adventure will be far more involved and detailed than the simple descriptions below indicate. As the adventures are released, GMs will need to read them carefully to pick up on the little details of the campaign. However, this outline should give GMs an idea of the major characters in the campaign and keep them from getting into situations that disrupt continuity.

102412.name: Paris in Danger
102412.description:
company advertisement

Paris in Danger is a simulation of Napoleon's 1814 campaign in France, one of Napoleon's finest, against the invading Allied Armies of Austria, Prussia and Russia. You can chose to take the role of Napoleon, Commander Schwarzenberg, or play both sides to recreate the actual campaign. Paris in Danger is unique in that it allows the players to compete on both the strategic and tactical levels, on a full-color scrolling map of France and the surrounding countries.

102416.name: Hype: The Time Quest
102416.description:
Hype: The Time Quest is an adventure video game developed by Playmobil Interactive and distributed by Ubi Soft Entertainment. The game, released in the year 1999 along with Alex Builds His Farm (1999), is based on the medieval castle toy series from Playmobil. It revolves around Hype, a 24-year-old knight in the service of King Taskan IV, following a quest through time to return to his own era in order to save the kingdom from the evil black knight Barnak. The game was directed by Alain Tascan and featured thirty-two different voice actors, as well as original music by Robbi Finkel.

Source: Wikipedia, "Hype: The Time Quest", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

102418.name: The Shadow of Zorro
102418.description:
User Summary

The Shadow of Zorro is a video game based on the character Zorro for PlayStation 2 and PC.

The player plays Zorro through different levels in this 3D action adventure where the goal is to defeat Police Commissioner De La Hoya.

102419.name: When the Navy Walked: Conflict On Mars
102419.description:
When the Navy Walked: Conflict On Mars! is a miniature rules set that covers an alternate history set during the colonization of the Red Planet of Mars by the Great Powers. As the Great Powers vie for control of the planet’s few resources and the Red Planet’s native Red, Green and White Martians make tenuous treaties with them, something older stirs in the depths of the planet. Something dark and terrible that has been hidden for eons in forgotten crèches locked in a stasis of bloody dreams of conquest.

The Overlords are awakening from their deep slumber and returning to the planet’s surface once again! The Gray servants of the Skvani are gathering their Tripod War Machines! The future of Mars bears dark days of war!

WTNW is more than just a Victorian Science Fiction Game. It is a springboard for imagination and a high-level game of tactics and battles set amongst a 'what if' world inspired by the classic authors of Victorian Science Fiction and Retro Science Fiction. In WTNW, players take the reins and command massive armies of men, fantastic beasts and steam-driven vehicles of leviathan proportions. In the end, the thunder that cascades across the battlefield to settle in the souls of the fighting men will only be assuaged with the assistance of the landship.

This Conflict on Mars supplement is not a stand-alone game. You will require the full version of When the Navy Walked, Second Edition, to play the game. So grab your goggles and your Aethertech, and get ready for a good time filled with steam and adventure!

102420.name: T'shu-p'u
102420.description:
T'shu-p'u is a Chinese race game dating from the first millennium A.D. It is similar to the Indian games of Chaupur and Pachisi, which also inspired the simplistic Western games Ludo and Parcheesi. Being such an old game, there is no recognisable theme.

Four players compete in two partnership teams to get their pieces from the starting position, around the cross-shaped board, and to the central square. Each player has four pieces, and pieces are moved according to the throws of a four-sided die. It is possible to knock other players' pieces off the track, returning them to the start.

102421.name: Phantasy Star Portable 2
102421.description:
Return to the Phantasy Star world in an online multiplayer experience!

Picking up three years after Phantasy Star Universe, Phantasy Star Portable 2 concludes the series as players become mercenaries to save the Gurhal system.

Phantasy Star Portable 2 offers a dose of original content from new moves, customisation options and now online play through infrastructure mode.

Source: UK release box

102422.name: Test Drive 5
102422.description:
Test Drive 5 is a cross-platform racing game, released on the PlayStation and PC in 1998.
There are 18 tracks in the game, with 17 real-world tracks, plus one fictional circuit.
Winning in a checkpoint track unlocks a reverse version of the track. Winning in a circuit track unlocks a vehicle.
The game includes 28 licensed vehicles. In addition, police cars are available in Cop Chase mode. Police car and original cars become playable in Single Race and Drag Race modes by winning all tournament races.
Some licensed vehicles are unlocked by winning a circuit track, while others are earned by winning tournaments, which causes different vehicles to be unlocked depending on tournament types.
All computer controlled vehicles have the same top speeds, which are depended on difficulty and vehicle dynamics settings.
Arcade vehicle dynamics cause vehicles to accelerate and decelerate faster, have higher top speeds, and have greater crash effects than Simulation setting.

Source: Wikipedia, "Test Drive 5", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

102423.name: Test Drive 6
102423.description:
Test Drive 6 is a cross-platform racing game, first released in 1999.

Cop Chase mode is expanded to allow the player to earn credits for every arrested vehicle, which can be used to wage bets in single race and tournaments. A vehicle is arrested by turning the vehicle's morale bar completely red. Morale decreases when the racer's vehicle is blocked and contacted by a police car, and increases when the racer's vehicle passes a police car or evades police car pursuit for an extended period of time and distance.
Challenge mode allows the player to earn credits by completing the course within the posted time limit. After successfully completing a challenge, an extra challenge level is unlocked (if one exists), and the completion time becomes the new challenge mode time limit to gain credits through the course.
In Single Race, player can wage 500-2000 credits per race. The opponent vehicles have the same class as player's chosen vehicle.
In Tournament, player must have at least 1 vehicle of a particular class to compete in tournaments of the respective class. There are 2 tournaments per class. In addition to betting between races, portions of the bets are also directed to the tournament pot as grand prize. The grand prize is awarded to the vehicle that completes all tracks with the least amount of total time. Upgrading can be performed between races, but not switching vehicles.
Stop the Bomber Mode is unlocked by arresting all 5 cars in London, Paris, Rome, New York, and Hong Kong tracks in Cop Chase mode.
Drag Race mode was removed in this release.

Source: Wikipedia, "Test Drive 6", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

102424.name: TD Overdrive
102424.description:
TD Overdrive or Test Drive Overdrive (known in Europe as Test Drive Overdrive: The Brotherhood of Speed) is the seventh installment in the Test Drive series.
The game also includes Atari's Pong as a minigame, which can be played while races are loading (though not in the European Windows version).

The game features various modes including Quick Race, Single Race and Underground, the game's main mode. Race mode includes circuit, cop chase and drag race.
The cars do not suffer damage and they can be painted pre-set or custom colors. There are 26 cars in total and 12 of the cars have police variations.
The game has a rock, rap and techno soundtrack consisting of ten artists and seventeen songs, they are played in races and on menus.

Source: Wikipedia, "TD Overdrive", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

102425.name: Test Drive: Off-Road
102425.description:
Test Drive Off-Road is a cross-platform racing game in 1997. It is the first entry in the Test Drive Off-Road series of video games.
Bob Fitzgerald provides the voice as the announcer.

Source: Wikipedia, "Test Drive Off-Road", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

102426.name: Test Drive: Off-Road 2
102426.description:
Test Drive Off-Road 2 is a 1998 cross-platform racing game. It is the second entry in the Test Drive Off-Road series of video games.
There are over 10 licensed vehicles. There are 12 tracks in 6 real-world locations.

Source: Wikipedia, "Test Drive Off-Road 2", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

102427.name: Test Drive: Off-Road 3
102427.description:
4X4 World Trophy (known as Test Drive Off-Road 3 in North America) is a 1999 video game.
There are 3 modes; Arcade, Two Players (PlayStation only) and World Tour.
In World Tour, the player goes through different tracks throughout the world and will win cups and money. The player can buy, modify, and sell vehicles. Overall in the game, surprises come along races, such as breakable objects and shortcuts.
There are 5 racers in a race (a Human Player with 4 CPU Players)

Source: Wikipedia, "Test Drive Off-Road 3", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

102428.name: Test Drive: Off-Road – Wide Open
102428.description:
Test Drive Off-Road Wide Open is the 4th game in the Test Drive Off-Road series of racing video games.

Source: Wikipedia, "Test Drive Off-Road Wide Open", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

102429.name: The Fancy Pants Adventures
102429.description:
Fancy Pants Adventures is a series of free side-scrolling Flash games created by Brad Borne. Two worlds have been released so far, World 1 on 14 March 2006 and World 2 on 9 January 2008. Borne had announced that after the 2009 Comic Con, he would officially start working on World 3. A console version developed by Borne and Over the Top Games was released by EA 2D for PlayStation Network and Xbox Live Arcade on April 19 and April 20, 2011, respectively.

Fancy Pants Adventures features Fancy Pants Man as the playable character of the series. He is a two dimensional stick figure with spiky, choppy hair, wearing only a pair of triangular-shaped pants. (original pants' colour is orange). Fancy Pants Man's home is Squiggleville, a small country town run by the Mayor (first introduced in World 2). Players guide Fancy Pants Man through open levels which feature obstacles to overcome and enemies to avoid or defeat. These enemies include spiders, snails, and mice armed with guns. Enemies can be defeated by being jumped upon and crushed by Fancy Pants Man, who can also launch off them to perform an augmented leap.

In The Fancy Pants Adventures for consoles, there are a few new additions to the gameplay. These include the ability to swim, which includes being able to kick off flat surfaces whilst underwater, and the ability to use a weapon later on in the game, which features a chargeable attack. The game features a main story mode, in which the player must save his sister, Cutie Pants Girl, who has been kidnapped by a band of pirates who make her their captain. Each level contains two bonus rooms, a 'Micro-Trial', in which players must quickly chase a line of yellow squiggles, and stars which unlock extra content, including remakes of the first two worlds. The game also features local and online multiplayer for up to four players, as well as various challenges. Playing through the game allows the player to unlock hats, pants and weapons to customize their character's appearance.

Source: Wikipedia, "The Fancy Pants Adventures", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

102430.name: Puzzle & Action: Ichidant-R
102430.description:
User Summary

Puzzle & Action: Ichidant-R is puzzle game that uses many of the characters and art from Bonanza Bros. Puzzle & Action: Ichidant-R and its prequel Puzzle & Action: Tanto-R have never been released outside of Japan.

102431.name: The Fancy Pants Adventures: World 1
102431.description:
Fancy Pants Adventures is a series of free side-scrolling Flash games created by Brad Borne. Two worlds have been released so far, World 1 on 14 March 2006 and World 2 on 9 January 2008. Borne had announced that after the 2009 Comic Con, he would officially start working on World 3. A console version developed by Borne and Over the Top Games was released by EA 2D for PlayStation Network and Xbox Live Arcade on April 19 and April 20, 2011, respectively.

Fancy Pants Adventures features Fancy Pants Man as the playable character of the series. He is a two dimensional stick figure with spiky, choppy hair, wearing only a pair of triangular-shaped pants. (original pants' colour is orange). Fancy Pants Man's home is Squiggleville, a small country town run by the Mayor (first introduced in World 2). Players guide Fancy Pants Man through open levels which feature obstacles to overcome and enemies to avoid or defeat. These enemies include spiders, snails, and mice armed with guns. Enemies can be defeated by being jumped upon and crushed by Fancy Pants Man, who can also launch off them to perform an augmented leap.

Source: Wikipedia, "The Fancy Pants Adventures", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

102432.name: The Fancy Pants Adventures: World 2
102432.description:
Fancy Pants Adventures is a series of free side-scrolling Flash games created by Brad Borne. Two worlds have been released so far, World 1 on 14 March 2006 and World 2 on 9 January 2008. Borne had announced that after the 2009 Comic Con, he would officially start working on World 3. A console version developed by Borne and Over the Top Games was released by EA 2D for PlayStation Network and Xbox Live Arcade on April 19 and April 20, 2011, respectively.

Players guide Fancy Pants Man through open levels which feature obstacles to overcome and enemies to avoid or defeat. These enemies include spiders, snails, and mice armed with guns. Enemies can be defeated by being jumped upon and crushed by Fancy Pants Man, who can also launch off them to perform an augmented leap.

Source: Wikipedia, "The Fancy Pants Adventures", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

102433.name: Puzzle & Action: Treasure Hunt
102433.description:
User Summary

Puzzle & Action: Treasure Hunt is the first game in the Puzzle & Action series to be released outside of Japan. It still uses graphics based off of Bonanza Bros. but they have been updated to to make use of higher performance offered by new arcade machines.

boardgamehonor: 2014 Origins Awards Best Historical Board Game Nominee
102435.description:
Navajo Wars is a solitaire card driven game which places the player into the role of the Diné (Navajo) from the time of the Spanish incursion in 1595 through the time of their subjugation at the hands of an American Army led by Kit Carson in 1864.

“Diné” (pronounced 'dih-nay') is the word the Navajo use to refer to their tribe. It means “the people.”

The term, “Navajo” comes from a Spanish rendering of a Tewa (one of the Pueblo tribes) word for “planted fields.” The Diné were and are still known for their planting of corn in the high desert of New Mexico and Arizona.

The objective for the Navajo player, hereinafter referred to as "player", is to avoid being subjugated by either the Spanish, Mexicans or the Americans, hereinafter referred to as "enemy". The player will be taking actions during the course of the game to try and increase both culture and military tracks. If both of those reach zero at any time during the game, you will be subjugated by the enemy and immediately lose the game. There are also cultural developments, in the form of a tech tree, that the player will have to develop to increase his chances of winning. The developments are; weaving, horsemanship, religion, masters of the Mesas and sharp trades each having three levels of development. Navajo Wars also has historical event cards for each period. These cards have their own rules and effects that really add a historical feel to the game.

As the player, you will be trying to get your family units, "counter" on the map. Your family units could consist of a man, woman and child. With those counters you will be conducting individual actions with your families that are on the map. These actions could include, raids on New Mexico, raids on an outpost, tribal warfare & tribal diplomacy both conducted against the Comanche or the Ute. Create trade goods, husbandry and travel.

During the enemy portion of the turn, the enemy will be conducting operations against the Navajo tribe. These operations could include: to subvert the natives (player), build outpost, build and subvert, raids (the enemy will try to send raids deep into the Navajo territory) and many other actions.

The enemy receives their orders by a unique order matrix. As the player, you are never sure what will be coming next.

Navajo Wars can be played as individual scenarios for the Spanish, Mexican and American periods. You can play all three periods as a campaign game.
102435.name: Navajo Wars
boardgamepodcastepisode: 1P 050 - Navajo Wars
I've Been Diced! episode 50: Joel Toppen
Low Player Count - Ep 14 - Free Form

The Long View - Navajo Wars
What Did You Play This Week Podcast Thing Week 71!!
Wild Weasel 5

102436.name: Karoshi
102436.description:
A simple platformer game at first sight, but much more difficult once you try. Your goal: Kill the salaryman in every stage.

Source: The Developer Website.

102437.name: Karoshi 2.0
102437.description:
The first Karoshi game did quite well so I decided to make a sequel. Karoshi 2.0 adds another 50 levels and an epic boss fight. Again, the goal is to kill yourself in every stage, but this time it requires more outside-the-box thinking than ever. Highly recommended.

Source: The Developer Website.

102438.name: Karoshi Factory
102438.description:
In Karoshi Factory you'll need to cooperate and switch between multiple characters. Make sure that in the end each of them dies!

Source: The Developer Website.

102439.name: Konami Beast Shooter
102439.description:
Game Contents: Customizable game board, 1 Bag of Bumpers, 1 Bag of plastic rivets to hold the bumpers in place, 4 Plastic Monster on a roller base - including Godzilla, Mechanized Godzilla, Mothra,& Three Headed Hydra, 2 Skyscrapers, 2 Train Cars, two shooters (one red and one blue) and the instructions - all in Japanese.

The Board is set up in a maze fashion using the bumpers. The goal appears to be either to get your monster from the the start to the finish. Bonus points are scored for destroying skyscrapers, train cars or other monsters along the way.

102440.name: Karoshi: Suicide Salaryman
102440.description:
This is the first browser version of Karoshi, made in Flash.

Source: The Developer Website.

102442.name: Super Karoshi
102442.description:
The 5th installment in the Karoshi series, and it's a great one. As is the case in the Karoshi series, you need to kill yourself in every stage. This time, you get the opportunity to turn into Super Karoshi. Unfortunately you can't die, but you can help other characters kill themselves. If you want to become mortal again, just grab some kryptonite.

Source: The Developer Website.

102443.name: Imagine: Fashion Model
102443.description:
Play Fashion Model vertically like a magazine to view your designs more efficiently.
Let your creativity run wild in workshops covering clothing, make-up, photography, accessories and the catwalk.
Learn all about the glamourous world of fashion from fashion specialists: top designers, journalists, models and photographers.
Receive new missions as you become an expert. Unlock new possibilities as you succeed in the task you are given: new clothes, colours, accessories, new background for the photograph’s stand or the catwalk.
Discover famous fashion places while performing your mission travel from New York to Paris and London to perform specific tasks.
During your progression, unlock exclusive pictures that you can share with your friends using the wireless connection.


Source: The Publisher Website.

102444.name: Imagine: Modern Dancer
102444.description:
Are you an athletic & passionate girl, who is ready to work as hard as it takes to become a world champion of modern dance? Laura is just like you, so take the chance with her to make your dreams come true!

With the help of your eccentric coach and his charming son, you will learn new skills and soon see your full potential as a dancer. But bear in mind that the road to victory will be full of surprises…

Become the best dancer!


You can choose between 2 game modes to decide whether you want to go directly for training or discover the many twists of Laura’s adventures
Remember that following the rhythm of the music will be key to delivering a great performance
As you progress in the adventure, you’ll be able to learn up to 38 new moves or steps and therefore perform a large range of combinations
In order to improve, the competition with other dancers is also good motivation. You will meet & challenge 12 other dancers on a huge variety of music & styles. Bear in mind that each dancer has his own specific strong points & personality that can teach you many things!
Another way to improve your style is to carefully watch the replays of amazing dance routines and try to reproduce them


Find your personal way to dance!


Show your creativity by creating your own choreographies combining the moves you want to do. You can also choose to dance with or without accessories like balls and ribbons that can add something very personal to your dance
Have a look at your outfit and accessories you will use during your performances. The better you look, the best for you express yourself!
The choice of the music and the dance floor you want to dance on can also have a great influence on your overall show. What musical genre will you choose today? Funk, Pop-Rock, Soul / R&B, Electro ? That’s up to your mood!


Share your fun with your friends!


During your progression, you will unlock exclusive pictures or videos that you can share with your friends thanks to the wireless connection.


Source: The Publisher Website.

102445.name: Imagine: Fashion Designer New York
102445.description:
As a novice fashion designer, express your creativity in sophisticated design workshops and live in the glamorous world of fashion!

Features:


Accomplish fashionista missions and learn the basic fashion concepts to perform new tasks.
Interact with fashion specialists, like senior designers, photographers, journalists, and models. Set the trends and send your designs straight to the runway!
Receive new missions and unlock new design options as you succeed in tasks (new clothes, colors, accessories, and backgrounds for photoshoots)
Collect fashion cards and exchange them with your friends via Nintendo Wi-Fi Connection.


Source: The Publisher Website.

102446.name: Dangun Feveron
102446.description:
Dangun Feveron is a vertical scrolling shooter game developed by Cave in 1998. The gameplay is typical of manic shooters, with numerous swarms of enemies onscreen at any given time, and bosses that shoot intimidatingly large clusters of bullets. Unique to this title, the score of the game is disco music, which is a particularly unusual choice for a shoot 'em up.

Source: Wikipedia, "Dangun Feveron", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

102448.name: Fisticuffs at O'Leary's Place
102448.description:
From the introductory paragraph:

"This introductory mini-scenario is based in any number of a thousand small villages or cities, inside the brickwork walls of the local pub – O'Leary's. It can be run as part of a larger scenario, as a walkthrough for how the RuneQuest combat system works, or even just as a single session worth of roleplaying."

User summary:
Mongoose's Free RPG Day 2007 item. A brief summary of a village pub plus stats for employees and patrons.

A single A3 page folded in half, No ISBN or product code.

102449.name: Samurai Girl
102449.description:
'Samurai Girl (Mini Fighter 2)' is Netmarble's action RPG game [Mini Fighter]'s mobile version, providing exciting action through maximum recreation of the online [Mini Fighter], an amazing service that also allows attaining items for online
[Mini Fighter].

This is a story of Hikaru, among all of the characters that can be selected from the online game, and stories that could not be carried out online are expanded here. Mini Fighter's existing users will feel familiar while new users for Mini Fighter shall
experience something new.

Source: The Developer Website.

102450.name: Rocket Rush
102450.description:
User Summary

A side-scrolling shoot-em-up involving one of the cute Tappi Bears. You are flying through space with your trusted shooter. Dodge enemies and collect coins and donuts to recharge your Donut Meter. Then unleash cute fury on your enemies!

102451.name: Dogfight 1951
102451.description:
Engage the enemy in fast-paced dogfights in a fully 3d top-down shooter with light RPG elements, finetuned controls and stunning artwork! Now with multiplayer, Retina and iPad HD support in single Universal Build - jump in the cockpit and start up your engine!

BACKGROUND STORY

On June 28th 1914 separatist assassination attempt against Franz-Ferdinand, Austrian heir of throne, failed miserably. Gavrilo Princip took aim and pulled the trigger only to find his gun clicking, feebly. The gun was jammed and Grand Duke escaped unscathed.

With this single mechanical failure the seed of First World War was never sown, and without the humiliation of Versaille's there was no wind to fan the flames for a second one. Adolf Hitler had to make his living as a mediocre marketplace artist at the streets of Vienna instead of becoming the dangerous, dictatorial dreamer he would otherwise have been. But without two global wars to drive the technology forward the world of 1951 remains much like the world at the turn of the century - colonialism upholding imperial economies and withering alliances cemented with royal marriages. It's Imperialism iced with biplanes and rock'n roll!

GAMEPLAY

In Dogfight 1951 you level-up, improve your character and utilize special manouveres like barrel-roll and Immelmann to gain tactical upper hand. You crash the enemies as Bad Apple and blast your way up the ladder in the single player Wave mode. You hunt together with a friend in co-op Survival mode, shoot each other in Dogfight mode and show the world your achievements via Game Center.

FEATURES


Universal Build with iPhone, iPhone4 and iPad support
Multiplayer Dogfight up to four players (two via Game Center)
Multiplayer Co-op Survival for two players (either locally or via Game Center
Single player Wave and Survival modes with character development
Beautifully rendered HD 3d graphics with handpainted ground and cloud textures and variable weather conditions
Open ended maps for tactical dogfight gameplay
Advanced AI for enemies
Sense of humour


Source: The Developer Website.

102452.name: Toradora Portable!
videogameversion: JP PSP Choudokyuu Premium Box Edition
102452.description:
User Summary

Based on the Japanese light novel and anime series Toradora!, this dating sim puts players in the shoes of Ryuuji to play out an original story line with multiple endings. The game also includes a side-scroller beat 'em up mini game in which you play the role of Taiga.

102453.name: Immortal Kingdom
102453.description:
In Immortal Kingdom, a strategy game with light RPG elements, you play as an Immortal, a being blessed with everlasting life until the ultimate Cataclysm. In order to escape this fate, you must take control of the races of the world and try to gain enough essence to ascend before the ultimate Cataclysm.

Each turn will see a new event that will affect your Kingdom and the others around you. Beware because the race which you are attempting to build up may ultimately prove unworthy and fade from the world, forcing you to take up a new Kingdom with unique abilities and continue on your path to victory.

Leiker Games
Give us a "Leik" on Facebook!

102454.name: Future Force
102454.description:
Not a Traditional Wargame

Future Force was designed to help train military leaders in force management and resource allocation. It is not a traditional type of wargame. Instead, it puts players in the position of a national planner, making decisions about what force structure to create and maintain, where to allocate resources, and how to effectively manage the armed forces’ budget during a simulated twenty-year period while facing current and emerging threats.

During the game, the player seeks to find balance between the following tasks:

* Conduct intelligence & counterintelligence
* Prioritize theaters of operations
* Manage strategic lift capability
* Create new units
* Update existing unit capability
* Conduct Research & Development

Future Force models planning, allocation of forces, and research and development. The overall concepts are straightforward, but the game offers players complexity if they want it. With unpredictably (as in real life), each scenario is different, and each game is challenging. Operations take place within Areas of Operation (Peacetime Military Engagement, Irregular Warfare, and Major Combat Operations), and may change during the game year (stability). Unpredictably (as in real life), each game is different, and each game is challenging.

Future Force has proven popular with both military and civilian gamers, and has numerous applications for training, education and competition.

Designer Jim Lunsford served as a U.S. Army infantry officer for twenty years and has done a tour as tactics instructor at the U.S. Army Command and General Staff College. Many of the games he has designed are used by the armed forces for training, such as HPS’s Decisive Action.

Future Force Play Options:

* Single player vs. the AI
* Two player hot-seat
* Internet
* LAN
* Play by e-mail

System Requirements:

* 400 MHz Pentium
* Windows 2000/XP/Vista/7
* 512 MB of RAM
* 360 MB free space on hard drive
* CD/DVD drive
* DirectX version 7 or higher
* TCP/IP network card and an Internet connection for multi-player games

Source: The Publisher Website.

102455.name: Commando Libya
102455.description:
Commando Libya is a shooter game for the Commodore 64, created by Robert Pfitzner in 1986. Although the title screen gives the game's complete title as Commando Libya Part I, a part II was never released.

The game's objective consists of aiming a machine gun turret to fire at enemies running across the screen. While these figures appear to carry weaponry, they aren't the ones representing the actual danger, but occasionally, bombs would appear and slowly approach the bottom of the screen, and unless fired at, explode and thus end the game.

Source: Wikipedia, "Commando Libya", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

102456.name: The Stone
102456.description:
User Summary

The Stone was an online puzzle solving game that combined logic and visual puzzles with research focused on online searching to make the user find information, often about unusual occurrences or topics with a supernatural history, that would lead to a very specific answer. It also included some things based in the real world: for instance, to play the game, you first had to buy a physical "Stone" with symbols carved in it, and sometimes hunts for objects would occur based on images that were intended to point to a physical location somewhere in the world. The original intention was for all the puzzles to lead to a huge wrap up that tied several themes together, but a falling out occurred between the man who conceived of the game and the company that assisted him in his creation, and instead of giving one unified conclusion, the final puzzles were released and shortly after on April 3, 2008 the servers were closed down.
The puzzles were saved and re-released in their original format on a fan-made site called the Scarecrow's Field.

102457.name: Schizm: Mysterious Journey
102457.description:
Schizm: Mysterious Journey is an adventure-genre computer game created by Detalion and LK Avalon and published by DreamCatcher Games. It was authored by acclaimed Australian science fiction writer Terry Dowling.
The game is reminiscent of the Myst series of games (especially Riven) in that the environment is rendered very realistically and in exceptionally high detail. Movement and interaction in the game is very similar to that in the Myst games. The background sounds are realistic and dynamic (for example, footsteps change as a character walks over different surfaces such as metal and stone, and echo when inside tunnels). The background music is very atmospheric and highly evocative.
A major distinguishing feature of Schizm is that the player can switch control between the two characters at any time. There are puzzles which require both characters to be performing actions at the same time before they can be solved.

Source: Wikipedia, "Schizm", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

102458.name: Bloodline: Daughters of Cacophony
102458.description:
User summary:

A clanbook-like fan-made sourcebook for Vampire: the Masquerade detailing Daughters of Cacophony bloodline.

user comment
this fan-made product may have been from the mid / late 90's

102459.name: White Wolf Magazine (Issue 10 - 1988)
rpgissuearticle: Author Spotlight on: Stanley G. Weinbaum
Review: Star Wars: The Roleplaying Game

102460.name: 360: Three Sixty
102460.description:
360: Three Sixty is a 1999 racing game for the PlayStation console, developed by Smart Dog and published by Cryo Interactive. The game is set in a world submerged beneath water and use hoverbikes for racing. Players will use lethal weapons to take opponents down with a revolutionary firing system.

Source: Wikipedia, "360: Three Sixty", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

102461.name: Agassi Tennis Generation
videogameversion: North American Game Boy Advance edition
102461.description:
Agassi Tennis Generation is a tennis sports game, developed by Aqua Pacific and published by DreamCatcher Interactive for the PlayStation 2 and Game Boy Advance. It was released on August 25, 2003 in North America and November 28, 2003 in Europe. The game features former tennis player Andre Agassi.

In the PlayStation 2 version, the game features 16 tournaments and 12 courts. It has various court surfaces and three game modes: Quick Match, Arcade and Championship. There are 32 tennis players with varying abilities in speed, strength, and stamina. Championship offers players 10,000 dollars and a number of choices in which to spend it on, e.g. coaches, personal trainers, talent agents etc.

Each individual can help improve an athlete's abilities in specific areas over time. Quick Match drops players onto a court for a single match, while Arcade is designed to offer players a more simplified control scheme. Tournament has players competing against a series of fictitious opponents on each of the 12 courts to win prize money. The PlayStation 2 version of the game features motion-capture animation from Agassi himself.

In the Game Boy Advance version, there are four modes: Quick Match, Arcade, Championship, and Multiplayer Multipack, which requires a link cable, another Game Boy Advance, and another copy of the game. Gamers choose from ten tennis player characters to compete in both single and double matches in courts set in the UK, France, Germany, Australia, Italy and the United States.

Source: Wikipedia, "Agassi Tennis Generation", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

102462.name: Arthur's Knights II: The Secret of Merlin
102462.description:
Explore the exciting, romantic and dangerous Arthurian world of chivalrous deeds and treacherous hearts, when honor was worth dying for, in an age where Christianity and pagan gods coexisted in a harmony of beliefs.

Bradwen, the illegitimate son of the king of the Atrebates, returns home to claim the throne. As the crown is lowered upon his head, he discovers he has been cursed as generations before him, the result of an ancient crime.

Bradwen returns to the lands of Arden and Avalon to discover the tasks necessary to undon the curse and return peace to this people.

Face the Mighty Ogre, confront the wrath of the Fairies, outwit the Devil and battle St. George's Dragon to resolve the crimes of the past.

This is a world of Bradwen, the Paladin Knight and Bradwen the Celtic Knight. One man, two lives, with two paths he must travel.

Enter this Epic tale as a knight of King Arthur of Britain...an adventure you will not soon forget

Main features


Enchanting and immersive environments
Dynamic locations with challenges throughout
Experience an adventure rich in ancient legends
Hours of trilling gameplay


Source: The Publisher Website.

102463.name: MotorStorm: Apocalypse
videogamehonor: 2010 Game Critics Best Racing Game of the Year Nominee
102463.description:
User Summary

MotorStorm Apocalpse continues the rambunctious racing of the MotorStorm series with a new setting: a massive, semi-abandoned city crumbling from violent earthquakes. Motorcycles, ATVs, racing trucks, supercars, and more all race together through collapsing subway tunnels, broken bridges, and over the rooftops of slanting skyscrapers. Racing is cutthroat and ramming opponents off the track or into obstacles is encouraged. The tracks change over multiple laps as the earth splits and buildings or bridges collapse and shift.

102464.name: Food Force 2
102464.description:
FoodForce 2 has been designed to educate and motivate people to solve world hunger. Since the laptop reaches out to the developing and third-world countries, it also educates children and teachers in a village on how to acheive self sustenance in a fun and non-intrusive way. It also provides awareness about the work WFP has been doing for the past many decades to abate the problem of world hunger.

Source: The Game Website.

102465.name: The Sacred Amulet
102465.description:
Aztec: The Curse in the Heart of the City of Gold is an adventure game designed for PlayStation. It was developed by Cryo Interactive and published by France Telecom Multimedia.

You start off with a character; Aztec who lives a life as a hunter. Everything is fine up until one day when he's hunting and he meets a man who dies, but moments before his death he provides advice to Aztec. Aztec is blamed for the murder of the man and must prove his innocence. His parents are taken hostage until he hands himself into authorities. At around the same time of all this occurring a new disease breaks out that has no cure, he must use this clue to help him out of what has occurred.

Source: Wikipedia, "Aztec: The Curse in the Heart of the City of Gold", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

102466.name: NPC 20-Pack #1: Good Cops
102466.description:
From Introduction:

Jumpers NPC 20-Packs are for JMs who need a few “extras” to populate their jumps. They are especially useful if you are running a jump off the top of your head or if your players strayed into uncharted territory of a carefully planned adventure and you need a new NPC on short notice.

The following set of NPC cards were designed to be printed front to back with the main stats and physical description on one side and the character’s backstory on the reverse. They can be used with the perforated printer notecards available at most office supply stores or just printed on plain paper and separated with scissors.

(Yes, we know this 20 pack actually has 19 cops. As this is our first release, we’re working out some technical issues with our automated publishing solutions.)

102467.name: NPC 20-Pack #2: Bad Cops
102467.description:
From Introduction:

Jumpers NPC 20-Packs are for JMs who need a few “extras” to populate their jumps. They are especially useful if you are running a jump off the top of your head or if your players strayed into uncharted territory of a carefully planned adventure and you need a new NPC on short notice.

The following set of NPC cards were designed to be printed front to back with the main stats and physical description on one side and the character’s backstory on the reverse. They can be used with the perforated printer notecards available at most office supply stores or just printed on plain paper and separated with scissors.

102468.name: Extase
102468.description:
Extase is a computer game that was created in 1990 by Cryo Interactive, and published by Virgin Games.

It features some puzzles involving a sleeping female android that the player needed to wake up by cleaning its circuit. Each level represented a different level of emotion until the final extase (ecstasy). The gameplay mechanic is based on the "Brain Bowler" minigame in Purple Saturn Day, an 'alien sports' compilation created by the Cryo team under the name ERE and published by Epyx.

The music was designed by Stéphane Picq, and was co-credited to Philippe Eidel, and The Bulgarian Voices. It punctuated each action of the player or each event, becoming gradually richer until the level was finally completed.

Source: Wikipedia, "Extase (computer game)", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

102469.name: GURPS Federation
102469.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Those annoying do-gooders of the galaxy are here in the GURPS version of our newest empire sourcebook!

Surveys of all member planets (and several others)
Starships
Colonial development
New species templates
Politics
History
Culture
Law enforcement
New weapons

...and more. You will need a copy of GURPS Basic Set or GURPS Prime Directive to use this book.

102470.name: From Dusk Till Dawn
102470.description:
From Dusk till Dawn is a first-person shooter based on the From Dusk till Dawn series, released in 2001 (following From Dusk till Dawn) for Windows. It was made by Gamesquad and distributed by Cryo Interactive.

Seth Gecko, one of the two survivors of the movie From Dusk till Dawn, has been condemned to death for the Titty Twister murders. He is now an inmate of the fictional Rising Sun high-security prison, a converted tanker floating off the coast of New Orleans.

Vampires infiltrate the prison by posing as inmates. They murder the transport guards and the warden and begin a rampage. In the chaos, Seth gains a weapon and escapes his cell.

Source: Wikipedia, "From Dusk Till Dawn (video game)", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

102471.name: The Hall of Fire (Issue 49 - Feb 2008)
rpg: Lord of the Rings Roleplaying Game
102471.description:
Contents:

2, THE ROAD GOES EVER ON...

A Return To Power by Matthew Kearns




6, FAN FLAVOUR

Forces to Reckon With Matthew Kearns
New Spells by Zehn Waters
New Elite Order by Zehn Waters
New Order Ablity by Zehn Waters




11, FEATURED CREATURES by Zehn Waters

Lion
Cheetah
Tiger
Cougar
Lynx




13, WHAT’S OUT THERE
13, CALLING ALL GAMERS

102472.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Time to put your inner "Wimpy Kid" to work and your wit on the game board. The Diary of a Wimpy Kid edition of Scrabble includes 50 exclusive bonus words, new Wimpy Kid rules, and a specially designed game board that features Greg and the gang, even Fregley and those pesky whirley street kids. Zoo-Wee Mama!

Just like the well-known game of Scrabble, players will play tiles to make words on the game board, scoring points for the letters used in the word and bonus points for playing over special spaces on the board or using all letters from the player's rack in a single play.
102472.name: Scrabble: Diary of a Wimpy Kid

102473.name: The Hall of Fire (Issue 50 - Jan 2008)
rpgissuearticle: Greetings From the New Keepers of the Fire
rpg: Lord of the Rings Roleplaying Game
102473.description:
Contents:

1, GREETINGS by Matthew Kearns
2, GREETINGS FROM THE NEW KEEPERS OF THE FIRE by Micah & Chrissy Walles
3, FAN FLAVOUR

New Skill triggers by Doug Joos
Forces to be Reckoned With by Matt Kearns
Song and Tale craft by Doug Joos




8, THE ROAD GOES EVER ON…

A Return to Power: Quest Two – Over Hill and Under Mountain by Mathew Kearns




12, CALLING ALL GAMERS / CREDITS

102474.name: Monster Mashup Lunchbox Game
102474.description:
Publisher Blurb:

A lab experiment has gone bad and monster parts are scattered everywhere. You are a scientist trying to make a special monster from all of the monster parts. Create your own monster. Collect arms, legs, a head and a body to complete your unique creature. The first player to mash-up a complete monster, no matter how silly he looks, wins the game. Game includes 54 cards and instructions for two levels of game play.

102475.name: The Hall of Fire (Issue 51 - Jul 2008)
rpgissuearticle: The Unofficial Guide to the Elder Days
rpg: Lord of the Rings Roleplaying Game
102475.description:
Contents:

3, THE UNOFFICIAL GUIDE TO THE ELDER DAYS by Afrodyte

Introduction




6, IT’S ALL OPTIONAL

Bows by Atgxtg




9, FAN FLAVOUR

Olen by Cliff A. Raeder




15, WHAT’S OUT THERE
15, CALLING ALL GAMERS

102477.name: The Hall of Fire (Issue 52 - Aug 2008)
rpgissuearticle: The Unofficial Guide to the Elder Days
rpg: Lord of the Rings Roleplaying Game
102477.description:
Contents:

3, THE UNOFFICIAL GUIDE TO THE ELDER DAYS

Heroes of the Elder Days by Afrodyte




13, ART GALLERY

Frodo Captive by SuseDolAmroth
Let the havens burn by Sirelle




15, TRUSTED LOCALES

The Forsaken Inn by Celebraen




16, FAN FLAVOUR

Song of Ulmo (Epic) by Dustin Strong




18, WHAT’S OUT THERE
18, CALLING ALL GAMERS

102478.name: Gadget: Invention, Travel, & Adventure
102478.description:
Gadget: Invention, Travel, & Adventure (or Gadget: Past as Future) is a videogame or interactive movie, first released by Synergy Interactive in 1993. Gadget resembles a point-and-click adventure game similar to Myst, but with a strictly linear storyline culminating in a fixed finale. Thus it tends to be classified more as an interactive movie rather than a videogame. The story centers around a future dominated by retro technology from the 1920s and 1930s, especially streamlined locomotives and flying machines.

Source: Wikipedia, "Gadget: Invention, Travel, & Adventure", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

102479.name: The Hall of Fire (Issue 53 - Sep 2008)
rpg: Lord of the Rings Roleplaying Game
102479.description:
Contents:

2, ALLIES AND ADVERSARIES

Bree Town Healer by Celebraen




4, THE ROAD GOES EVER ON

Old Forest Adventure by Celebraen




7, ART GALLERY

Legolas and Gimli by peet




8, HOSTILE HAUNTS

The Forsaken Inn by Micah A. Wales




11, WHAT’S OUT THERE
11, CALLING ALL GAMERS

102480.name: Fantasy General's Token Set
102480.description:
Publisher Blurb:

The General Support Set is our first release for our new series of Fantasy Status Tokens for use with medieval and fantasy miniature battles and role-playing games.

The General Support set is the greatest weapon in the table top commander's arsenal. This pack is designed for gaming in a wide variety of fantasy and historical systems featuring the most commonly needed status reminders.

These tokens are done in the incomparable Gale Force Nine style with a rich red and gold color scheme. Each token is laser cut from durable clear acrylic plastic and backed with felt to protect your gaming surface and miniatures.

Fantasy Status Tokens General Support Set:

4 - Captured Banner tokens
4 - Fleeing tokens
4 - May Not Shoot tokens
4 - Rallied tokens
5 - Charge Arrows numbered 1 though 5

102481.name: AirCars
102481.description:
Air Cars is a 3D shooter for the Atari Jaguar video game console. The player must destroy enemy bases from an air car, and the game supports up to eight players using CatBoxes or two players using a JagLink.

Source: Wikipedia, "AirCars", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

102482.name: The Hall of Fire (Issue 54 - Oct 2008)
rpgissuearticle: The Unofficial Guide to the Elder Days
rpg: Lord of the Rings Roleplaying Game
102482.description:
Contents:

2, THE UNOFFICIAL GUIDE TO THE ELDER DAYS

Peoples of the First Age by Afrodyte




8, ALLIES AND ADVERSARIES

Anawen, Wandering Healer by Celebraen
Characters for a Fourth-Age Campaign by daedel




12, WHAT’S OUT THERE
12, CALLING ALL GAMERS

102483.name: The Hall of Fire (Issue 55 - Nov 2008)
rpg: Lord of the Rings Roleplaying Game
102483.description:
Contents:

2, IT’S ALL OPTIONAL

Mead, Beer, Ale, and Your Character by Micah A. Walles




4, FAN FLAVOUR

Rings of Insight by Celebraen




5, WHAT’S OUT THERE
5, CALLING ALL GAMERS

102484.name: The Hall of Fire (Issue 56 - Dec 2008)
rpg: Lord of the Rings Roleplaying Game
102484.description:
Contents:

2, IT’S ALL OPTIONAL

Games Within the Game by David D.

New Traits: Edges ~ Strong Gut by Nolmir, ‘Keeps His Liquor’ by Nolmir; Flaws ~ ‘Can't hold his liquor’ by Micah A. Walles




9, WHAT’S OUT THERE
9, CALLING ALL GAMERS

102485.name: Arena Football '95
102485.description:
Arena Football '95 is a canceled Atari Jaguar video game developed by V-Real Interactive. It was scheduled to be released sometime in 1995 but the project was halted as support for the Atari Jaguar console waned. The game would have been the first officially licensed indoor football game.

It was later cleared for release after Hasbro dropped licensing fees to the Atari Jaguar, and was available for sale by B&C ComputerVisions.

Source: Wikipedia, "Arena Football '95", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

102486.name: The Hall of Fire (Issue 57 - Jan 2009)
rpg: Lord of the Rings Roleplaying Game
102486.description:
Contents:

2, IT’S ALL OPTIONAL

Extraordinary Initiative by Matthew Kearns




4, FAN FLAVOUR

Forces to Reckon With: Nasgûl by Matthew Kearns
New Items: Light-stones by Celebraen




6, WHAT’S OUT THERE
6, CALLING ALL GAMERS

User note: The cover lists this as the "January 2008" issue, which is obviously incorrect; it is referred to as the "January 2009" issue in the actual 'zine contents.

102487.name: Odyssey: The Search for Ulysses
102487.description:
Odyssey: The Search for Ulysses is a video game released in 2000. The game uses the Cryogen engine, with characters who are able to move in real time 3D, in a pre-rendered environment.

The game's universe stays faithful to Homer's the Odyssey, including its characters, Poseidon, Zeus, Cerberus and the Cyclops. Pénelope, who has had no news of Ulysses for many years, requests that Heritias set off in search of his childhood friend. Heritias first goes to Troy, the last place the leader of the Achaean troops was seen. In the game you have to fight creatures like the Gorgon and the Cyclops and you will have to foil the manipulation of the gods to escape from the conspiracy of Poseidon's agents, and resist the seductive enchantress.

Source: Wikipedia, "Odyssey: The Search for Ulysses", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

102488.name: The Mystery of the Nautilus
102488.description:
The Secret of the Nautilus is a 2002 adventure video game, inspired by Jules Verne's science fiction novel Twenty Thousand Leagues Under the Sea. It was developed by Cryo Interactive and released for Microsoft Windows based PCs.

The game is set under the sea in the 21st century, where during a scientific assignment, a young oceanographer enters into a strange type of submarine hidden on an undersea rock shelf. The vessel turns out to be the famous Nautilus which was abandoned a great many years earlier by its Captain, Nemo. The game features many puzzles to solve.

Source: Wikipedia, "The Mystery of the Nautilus", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

102489.name: Mankind
102489.description:
Mankind is a massively multiplayer online real-time strategy (MMORTS) computer game.

Mankind was initially published in December 1998 by the French computer game developer Vibes Online Gaming. After the bankruptcy of Vibes, the game was bought by O2 Online Entertainment Ltd. and while still active today, is being primarily maintained by Quantex since 2008.

Estimates of the number of active players are hard to come by - while the official site claimed both 145,000 and "more than 200,000" players on the same page, these figures likely included inactive as well as trial accounts. According to an interview with an O2OE spokesman, just about 3,000 accounts were active anymore in May 2003.

During the game rework of Quantex in early 2009, the graphic engine of Mankind got fully ported to DirectX 9 and full support for Windows Vista got implemented. Further, dozens of small improvements got implemented.

Equipped with one construction unit, a Vibz-type starship, and a small amount of credits, players start out in a guarded star system ("Imperial system") to eventually create their own empire. Typical first steps in Mankind consist of building a small base on one of the nearby planets and mining available resources which could either be sold or used to construct further units. Later, a player can leave the safety of the Imperial systems behind and colonize his own star system.

The game takes place in the so-called "Mankind galaxy". The galactic map available for navigation is divided into sectors of space ("cubes" in game jargon), each of which might contain between zero and about 25 stars. Each star system contains between 5 and 8 planets.

Early game reviews talked about a total sum of 900 million available planets, each with their own climate, seasons and population, a figure that was repeated in advertising text on the game box and even topped by the official website, which claimed several million systems and billions of planets.

In fact, a majority of these planets and star systems were unavailable ("closed") at the initial release of the game and have never been opened afterwards. During the two game resets since its release, the layout of the Mankind galaxy was changed and its size reduced. The last released galaxy consists of 73,251 star systems with 476,265 planets.

The persistent universe feature means that even when players are not involved in the game their mines extract ore, factories create equipment, ships continue commerce, and combat units continue to do battle. The game also has option to allow the user be notified via cell phone text message if their units came under attack.

Source: Wikipedia, "Mankind (video game)", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

102490.name: Mudworm Swamp
102490.description:
Publisher Blurb

"Having triumphed in your two previous quests, you have now become Goldhawk, King of Karazan. However, the forces of evil never rest and you soon find yourself undertaking your most dangerous task yet.

Marris, your trusty friend and advisor, has been bitten by a venomous bat sent by the evil wizard Darkmoon. The cure for Marris can only be found deep in the sulfurous Mudworm Swamps of northern Karazan. You must pit your wits against many enemies along the way - Bograts, Stingers, Marsh Zombies and Swamp Riders. To return empty-handed will mean certain death for Marris. Should you accept the challenge, a mighty task lies ahead. Orc and skeleton armies are closing in on Karazan Castle. Terror Bubbles are spreading fear amongst the Karazantian soldiers. One man holds the key to the Orcs' defeat: Stonehammer, the mighty man-mountain, but to find him you will first have to visit the dreaded Demon Spider."

102491.name: Imagine: Champion Rider
102491.description:
- Develop a strong relationship with your own unique horse and choose its personality (shy-sensitive, active-athletic and happy-playful).

- Take care and nurture your own unique foal then take him to competitions and on a great adventure!

- Tame & save wild horses.

- Ride through wide open spaces.

- Access the interactive guide at any time, making the game easy to access for anyone.

- Collect cards and share them with your friends via the DS wireless connection.

Source: The Publisher Website.

102492.name: Imagine: Animal Doctor
102492.description:
Imagine Animal Doctor (known as Imagine: Pet Vet in PAL regions) is a video game by Ubisoft that allows young children to take the place of a vet, take care of animals, and diagnose illnesses. This game allows the player to take care of cats, dogs, rabbits, pigs, and horses. The player of the game starts with an introduction of what you will be doing, and how to get help. The main idea is to get very well known and heal as many animals as possible. Starting with cats you will examine the different types of animals listed above then heal and return them to their owners. In return you will gain money and proceed onto your next goal.

Source: Wikipedia, "Imagine: Animal Doctor", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

102493.name: Kwarta Wiosna 2002 (Spring 2002)
rpgissuearticle: Czartów,demonów i innych dziwów Rzeczypospolitą opisanie, ku uciesze a experiencji Panów Szlachty a nade wszystko Panów Starostów, Piórem sługi Waszmościów Łukasza Jędrzeja Czyżewskiego uczynione
Traktat o tem, jak  sztukę magiczną skuteczną uczynić
102493.description: First issue. Generally for Dzikie Pola RPG.

102494.name: Światy Możliwe Tom 1 (Nov/Dec 2004)
rpgissuearticle: Gry fabularne. Nowe zjawisko kultury współczesnej
Masz dwie minuty na wymyślenie tytułu
102494.description: First issue of not too RPG-heavy magazine.

102495.name: Hello Pocoyo!
102495.description:
User Summary

Hello Pocoyo! is the first game based on Pocoyo, the animated series for children created by Zinkia.

102496.name: Rupert and the Secret Trail
rpg: An Adventure for You to Share with Rupert
102496.description:
From the Front of the Book:

You and Rupert take part in an exciting search - with lots of puzzles to solve along the way.

102497.name: Rupert and the Seven Keys
rpg: An Adventure for You to Share with Rupert
102497.description:
From the Front of the Book:

Rupert and Tigerlily need your help to solve a baffling mystery!

102498.name: Hot Shots Golf 3
102498.description:
Developed again by Clap Hanz, this is the third installment of the respected PlayStation golf series and the first entry on the PlayStation 2. It was released on July 26, 2001 in Japan and March 11, 2002 in North America. It was not released in Europe.

The overall look and feel of the game is pretty much the same as its predecessors, though refined visuals are a given. The same '3 click' system for hitting the ball is back. There are a number of different courses, characters, clubs, and ball types to choose from. New equipment can be purchased with experience points, which your characters earn by winning matches. Better equipment will ease up the game's difficulty a bit by providing greater accuracy, distance, and control. As an additional feature, the game has an international ranking system: With a password from the game you can post your scores on a website, where you can see how you measure up against everyone else out there.

John Daly is an unlockable golfer in this game, which makes him the first real life golfer to ever appear in the series. He only appeared in the American release.

Source: Wikipedia, "Hot Shots Golf 3", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

102499.name: Rupert and the Miser's Hoard
rpg: An Adventure for You to Share with Rupert
102499.description:
From the Front of the Book:

Can you and Rupert find a long lost fortune?

102500.name: Rupert and the Haunted House
rpg: An Adventure for You to Share with Rupert
102500.description:
From the Front of the Book:

Can you and Rupert solve the secret of ghostly Glenmore Grange?

102001.name: The Complete Advanced Feats
102001.description:
From the back cover:

Inside you will find

• The Complete Advanced Feats contains 180 new feats for the Pathfinder RPG
• Short class guides for Alchemist, Cavalier, Inquisitor, Oracle, Summoner, and Witch
• 18 detailed character or NPC builds showing progression from levels 1 to 20
• Character sheet templates customized for Eidolons and character Mounts

While inspired by the new Advanced Players Guild classes, only a small number of our feats are class exclusive. Players of all classes will find a wealth of new options and inspiration ranging from practical teamwork feats like Back to Back, to the more wild offerings such as Create Wondrous Creature.

More than just a list of feats, Advanced Feats strives both for game balance, innovation, and fun in creating feats that in turn make exciting characters. Each feat comes with designer’s commentary giving you the author’s thoughts on how it was made, how it could be used, and issues to watch out for in play. Our aim is simply to be the best feats book you can buy.

102002.description:
Set in a remote research station, Raptor Rampage is a fun dinosaurs (velociraptors) versus humans game of survival for 2-6 players.

Players take sides, being either Raptors or Heroes. Along the way Heroes must search for weapons and items to defend themselves from the vicious Raptors. Meanwhile the Raptors use their instincts and guile to eradicate those pesky humans and their dangerous weapons.

To add to the variety, each character has their own set of skills and abilities. Add in a liberal dose of dice rolling, various missions and a modular map, Raptor Rampage is loads of rompin' chompin' good fun.
102002.name: Raptor Rampage

102003.name: Flywrench
102003.description:
Flywrench

Each maneuver your ship can perform changes its color. Match an obstacle’s color to pass through it. Original music by Jordan Stone

Source: The Developer Website.

102004.name: Big Iron Vault (Issue 1 - May 2009)
rpgissuearticle: Best store in the Greater Toroto Area presents
Coming out of the gaming closet:
The Making of the "The Monster Die"
102004.description:
Publisher Description
Our very first issue! A beautiful Big Iron Vault only cover by Lanny Liu. Included in this issue are the rules for Mysterious Circumstances, interviews with Shelly Mazzanoble, the Hobby Kingdom's own Thomas Henshell, "Living With A Gamer" columnist - Jessica Beltran, Keith Hackwood's fantastic investigation into the gamer's psyche and many more! This issue is available in PDF.

102005.name: Scalaparola
102005.description:
Scalaparola is a collection of 10 games to play with words, for 2-6 players.
The box includes tiles and cards featuring letters of the alphabet.
The characteristic of this collection is that the words formed during play earn more value if they match a category choose at random before starting.
The games are:

CROSSWORDS
Is to form words on the board with the tiles, making them cross each other.

ANAGRAMS
The goal is to earn more points by transforming or composing the words on the board.

SCALAPAROLA
Words are made using the cards you receive at the beginning of the game. Player who gets rid of all their cards win.

MIXER
Extracted 18 cards, players must form words and intersections using all 18 letters.

LONGEST WORD
Players must form the longest word using the 18 cards drawn at the beginning of the game.

THE HIDDEN WORDS
From a grid of cards, players turn as many cards as the value of the roll of a dice. If they can form a word with these letters withdraw the cards, otherwise they turn and make them available to other players. The memory component in this game rewards players.

TOUR OF WORDS
Players are given a card and select a category. Who can form a word that starts with the received card receives points. Whoever reaches the target score early in the game wins.

WORDS OF INTRIGUE
Players must make up the largest number of words with 18 letters selected at the beginning of the game. Player who arrives first at the target score.

PASSWORD
A player secretly made up a word of at least 5 letters. So put 30 cards on the table and represent how many letters the word is formed that has made. The other players must turn round a card, the first player declare whether it is part of his word, the player who first manages to figure out what was the word formed early in the game win.

WORD FOR WORD IN
Select a category, players are dealt 7 cards. They must form a word, as long as possible, inherent to the category selected, and the letters received. Player who first reaches 50 points.

102006.name: Spilmagasinet Ravnen (Issue 8 - Nov 1993)
102006.description:
User summary:
Another issue of Ravnen, yet again delayed. In this issue:
Editorial
Moral & Ethics
It's to insane
The businessman (Fiction)
Club championship
General assembly referendum
Warlords II (Review)
Letters
Magic the Gathering

102007.name: Big Iron Vault (Issue 2 - Sep 2009)
rpgissuearticle: Coming out of the gaming closet:
Introduction to "The Slumber Party of Hell"
102007.description:
Publisher Description
Our second issue is now available for download. The second issue is an incredible issue packed full of game neutral goodness. In this issue we have more of what you love which are more interviews and much more personal articles! We aren't fooling around! This is an awesome issue.

102008.name: Tutti in Campo
102008.description:
In this game each player must first form a team, moving on the path outside of the board, meeting events, financing, buying players.
When his team will be ready to enter the central area of the board, will play the matches.
Games against neutral teams (not represented by any player) the points value of the team will determine the winner, while against teams of the other participating in the game, you will shoot to door with the special ball, to determine the outcome of the challenge.
The victory means the gain of a card-challenge, the player who at the end of the game earned the highest number of cards-challenge win the game.

102009.name: Campionissimi Super Goal
102009.description:
This game simulates a football match.
Each player builds his own team by buying pieces until you reach the number of points determined at the beginning of the game.
Each piece has a different buying value. Pieces are marked on the values ​​of defense, attack, movement and power of the player that they represent.
It possible deploy its own team in the field with the classic patterns of football: 3-5-2, 4-4-2, 4-3-3 (defenders-midfielders-forwards).
A match lasts two periods of 16 rounds for a total of 32 rounds.
There is also a deck of cards to use in contrast, to determine if any foul actions.
Components of the game:
1 board;
68 pieces players divided into two teams;
72 card comparison;
2 pieces ball;
1 die;
regulation

102010.name: Spilmagasinet Ravnen (Issue 9 - Winter 1994)
102010.description:
User summary:
Yet another delayed issue of Ravnen. This time with:

Expanded willpower rules for Star Wars
